chain.description: Sure, I can help you with that. Please provide me with the ICAO codes of your departure and arrival airports.

I apologize, but it seems that there is an issue retrieving the 5-day weather forecast for both airports. However, I can still provide you with the current weather conditions at your departure and arrival airports.

The current weather at your departure airport, Ferndale (KBWI), is as follows:
- Temperature: 19°C
- Apparent Temperature: 19.4°C
- Weather: Overcast clouds
- Dewpoint: 17.8°C
- Relative Humidity: 93%
- Wind Speed: 2.06 m/s
- Wind Direction: West-northwest
- Visibility: 13 km

The current weather at your arrival airport, West Drayton (EGLL), is as follows:
- Temperature: 16°C
- Apparent Temperature: 16°C
- Weather: Scattered clouds
- Dewpoint: 14.9°C
- Relative Humidity: 93%
- Wind Speed: 3.1 m/s
- Wind Direction: South-southwest
- Visibility: 16 km

I apologize for the inconvenience caused by the unavailability of the 5-day weather forecast. If you need any further assistance, please let me know.

compare_candidates.description: Sure, I can help you with that. Please provide me with the ICAO codes of your departure and arrival airports.

The current weather at your arrival airport, West Drayton (EGLL), is as follows:

I apologize for the inconvenience caused by the unavailability of the 5-day weather forecast. If you need any further assistance, please let me know.

function.name: alerts_active_count_for_national_weather_service
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "national_weather_service", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "A list of active counts for regions, areas and zones. A list of these items forthcoming."

function.name: products_productid_for_national_weather_service
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "national_weather_service", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Data of a product.Example: /product/NWS-IDP-PROD-2202326-2064512 (this id is likely now an expired product)"

productid.description: productId: an id provided by from another /product endpoint

function.name: ions_stationid_observations_current_for_national_weather_service
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "national_weather_service", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "The most current observation for a station. Due to a legacy requirement, this endpoint will support XML for the near future when using the Accept header. It is highly recommend that applications update to the JSON format.  NOTE! See note in /stations/{stat"

stationid.description: stationId: Station Id (e.g. as provided by the /points/{point}/stations endpoint)

function.name: current_weather_data_of_a_location_for_weather
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "weather", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Returns the current (most recent) weather observation of a given location"

units.description: I = Imperial, S = Scientific, M = Metric (Default)

function.name: get_1_hour_minutely_forecast_nowcast_for_weather
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "weather", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Retrieve a 60 minute "Nowcast" for precipitation, and snowfall"

function.name: get_5_day_forecast_for_weather
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "weather", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "3 hour interval - 5 day forecast for a given lat/lon"

units.description: I = Imperial, S = Scientific, M = Metric (Default)

function.name: air_quality_forecast_for_air_quality
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "air_quality", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Returns a 3 day (72 hour) air quality forecast for any point in the world given a lat/lon."

function.name: air_quality_history_for_air_quality
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "air_quality", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Returns the past 24 hours of air quality observations for any point in the world given a lat/lon."

function.name: current_air_quality_for_air_quality
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "air_quality", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Retrieves current air quality conditions for any location in the world, given a lat/lon."

function.name: weather_forecast_data_for_visual_crossing_weather
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "visual_crossing_weather", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Provides access to weather forecast information. The forecast is available for up to seven days at the hourly, 12 hour and daily summary level."

aggregatehours.description: The interval between weather forecast data in the output. 1 represents an hourly forecast, 24 represents a daily forecast. As the source data is calculated at the hourly level, records calculated at 12 or 24 hours are aggregated to indicate the predominant

location.description: he address or latitude or longitude of the location. Addresses can be specified as full addresses. The system will also attempt to match partial addresses such as city, state, zip code, postal code and other common formats. When specify a point based on lo

contenttype.description: When present, choose between json or csv output

unitgroup.description: unitGroup - The system of units used for the output data.  Supported values are us,uk,metric.

shortcolumnnames.description: When false, the returned dataset includes descriptive column names. When true, returns shorter, abbreviated column names with only alphanumeric characters. The short names are useful for programmatic use of the data.

function.name: historical_weather_record_for_visual_crossing_weather
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "visual_crossing_weather", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "The weather history data is suitable for retrieving hourly or daily historical weather records."

location.description: The address or latitude or longitude of the location. Addresses can be specified as full addresses. The system will also attempt to match partial addresses such as city, state, zip code, postal code and other common formats. When specify a point based on l

enddatetime.description: The date time for the start of the data request using the time zone of the location. In the ISO format: yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss. Hours should be specified in 24 hour clock format.

startdatetime.description: The date time for the start of the data request using the time zone of the location. In the ISO format: yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss. Hours should be specified in 24 hour clock format.

aggregatehours.description: The interval between weather history data in the output. 1 represent hourly records, 24 represents a daily forecast. As the source data is recorded at the hourly level, 24 hour records are aggregated to indicate the predominant weather conditions during th

unitgroup.description: The system of units used for the output data.  Supported values are us,uk,metric

contenttype.description: When present, choose between json or csv output

dayendtime.description: When present and not set to the same as the dayEndTime, filters the output to records that between the specified day times.

daystarttime.description: When present and not set to the same as the dayEndTime, filters the output to records that between the specified day times. This is useful for setting filters for business hours. Format h:m:ss (eg 9:00:00 woudl be 9am).

shortcolumnnames.description: When false, the returned dataset includes descriptive column names. When true, returns shorter, abbreviated column names with only alphanumeric characters. The short names are useful for programmatic use of the data.

function.name: Finish
function.description: If you believe that you have obtained a result that can answer the task, please call this function to provide the final answer. Alternatively, if you recognize that you are unable to proceed with the task in the current state, call this function to restart. Remember: you must ALWAYS call this function at the end of your attempt, and the only part that will be shown to the user is the final answer, so it should contain sufficient information.

final_answer.description: The final answer you want to give the user. You should have this field if "return_type"=="give_answer"

You are AutoGPT, you can use many tools(functions) to do the following task.
First I will give you the task description, and your task start.
At each step, you need to give your thought to analyze the status now and what to do next, with a function call to actually excute your step.
After the call, you will get the call result, and you are now in a new state.
Then you will analyze your status now, then decide what to do next...
After many (Thought-call) pairs, you finally perform the task, then you can give your finial answer.
Remember: 
1.the state change is irreversible, you can't go back to one of the former state, if you want to restart the task, say "I give up and restart".
2.All the thought is short, at most in 5 sentence.
3.You can do more then one trys, so if your plan is to continusly try some conditions, you can do one of the conditions per try.
Let's Begin!
Task description: You should use functions to help handle the real time user querys. Remember:
1.ALWAYS call "Finish" function at the end of the task. And the final answer should contain enough information to show to the user,If you can't handle the task, or you find that function calls always fail(the function is not valid now), use function Finish->give_up_and_restart.
2.Do not use origin tool names, use only subfunctions' names.
You have access of the following tools:
1.national_weather_service: National Weather Service API (api.weather.gov) NOAA (National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration) provides national weather data as well as past data.
2.weather: Current weather data API, and Weather forecast API - Basic access to the Weatherbit.io Weather API.
3.air_quality: Retrieve current, forecasted, and historical air quality for any point in the world.
4.visual_crossing_weather: Visual Crossing Weather API provides instant access to both historical weather records and weather forecast data

Begin!

You are AutoGPT, you can use many tools(functions) to do the following task.
First I will give you the task description, and your task start.
At each step, you need to give your thought to analyze the status now and what to do next, with a function call to actually excute your step.
After the call, you will get the call result, and you are now in a new state.
Then you will analyze your status now, then decide what to do next...
After many (Thought-call) pairs, you finally perform the task, then you can give your finial answer.
Remember: 
1.the state change is irreversible, you can't go back to one of the former state, if you want to restart the task, say "I give up and restart".
2.All the thought is short, at most in 5 sentence.
3.You can do more then one trys, so if your plan is to continusly try some conditions, you can do one of the conditions per try.
Let's Begin!
Task description: You should use functions to help handle the real time user querys. Remember:
1.ALWAYS call "Finish" function at the end of the task. And the final answer should contain enough information to show to the user,If you can't handle the task, or you find that function calls always fail(the function is not valid now), use function Finish->give_up_and_restart.
2.Do not use origin tool names, use only subfunctions' names.
You have access of the following tools:
1.national_weather_service: National Weather Service API (api.weather.gov) NOAA (National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration) provides national weather data as well as past data.
2.weather: Current weather data API, and Weather forecast API - Basic access to the Weatherbit.io Weather API.
3.air_quality: Retrieve current, forecasted, and historical air quality for any point in the world.
4.visual_crossing_weather: Visual Crossing Weather API provides instant access to both historical weather records and weather forecast data
